summary:
Andalusia is a region in southern Spain, known for its rich history and unique culture. It is the largest and most populous autonomous community in Spain, with eight provinces: Almería, Cádiz, Córdoba, Granada, Huelva, Jaén, Málaga, and Seville. The capital is Seville.

The name comes from the Arabic word "Al-Andalus." Its history includes many cultures: Tartessians, Romans, Moors, and more. The region is famous for flamenco, bullfighting, and Moorish architecture.

Andalusia has a hot climate, especially in the inland areas, with summer temperatures often above 36°C (97°F).
title: Andalusia
